text: one of the things that struck me about
the conversations that were taking place
earlier today was a comment that someone
made about the um comparison between
integrated reporting and behavioral
issues relating to um the medical
profession um one of the things that
that sort of made stick in my mind was
that um to a large extent it seems as
though the approach that's been used by
the auditing profession and in the
reporting industry so far has been one
of more of a almost mechanical or a um
an engineering Focus where you're
basically measuring
um uh a lot of financial data and
information on a backward looking basis
and you're giving sort of of a snapshot
in time analysis of what the um sort of
structural Integrity of the company
is and um sort of thinking about the the
the doctor the medical sort of approach
to the sort of auditing and Reporting
function seemed to me to be really sort
of a nice way to reframe reframe the uh
the issues where you're actually looking
at more than just getting the sort of
biological measures the blood pressure
uh the blood test readings and that sort
of thing but you're also kind of looking
at forward-looking um risks some of the
behavioral issues or genetic issues that
a patient might have and a company
you're really talking about reputational
issues or um health and safety issues or
the uh sort of uh the uh uh the human
capital that may be necessary for a
company so
and looking at it from a longer term
perspective which I think is really sort
of necessary if you're going to be an
investor in a company the integrated
reporting approach I think helps if you
look at it as more of a sort of a
medical opinion a medical reporting sort
of approach to uh kind of testing the
health of a company over the long term
and as an investor then you can make a
decision as to whether or not you would
like to invest in that company whether
you think it's got a long-term future or
whether you think that company is going
to be dead um in a month or two I think
just by reframing some of the integrated
reporting um ways of thinking as being
sort of a longer term sort of biological
approach to evaluating the health of a
company I think it helps to reframe kind
of the uh what's being done
